conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C and pass through baffles to reach containers D, E, or F.

The image shows three starting points labeled A (pink), B (green), and C (blue) at the top. There are several baffles (black, yellow, blue, green) guiding the flow of liquid downward. At the bottom, there are containers labeled D, E, F, and G.
The black baffle is positioned diagonally to divert liquid to the left.
The yellow baffle is positioned diagonally to divert liquid to the right.
The blue baffle is positioned diagonally to divert liquid slightly to the right.
The green baffle is positioned diagonally to divert liquid slightly to the right.

premise: Liquid from A flows downward and encounters the black baffle, which diverts it to the left. It continues downward and encounters another baffle that guides it further left.
conclusion: Liquid from A flows into container D.

premise: Liquid from B flows downward and encounters the yellow baffle, which diverts it slightly to the right. Another baffle pushes it back toward the center.
conclusion: Liquid from B flows into container E.

premise: Liquid from C flows downward and encounters the green baffle, which pushes it slightly to the right. Another baffle further guides it toward the right side.
conclusion: Liquid from C flows into container F.

premise: Streams A and B meet the yellow baffle and slide along it to the right. Meanwhile, stream C flows straight down. A and B then merge and collide with C.
conclusion: All the liquid from A, B, and C flows into container G, leaving D, E, and F empty.
